topic: How to benchmark edge runtimes using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to benchmark edge runtimes using fastapi with Python 3.12+
response_raw:
{
  "title": "Benchmarking Edge Runtimes with FastAPI using Python 3.12+",
  "summary": "This guide explains how to utilize FastAPI and Python 3.12+'s built-in profiling tools to benchmark the performance of edge runtime applications.",

  "key_points": [
    "Install necessary packages: FastAPI, Uvicorn, and aprofiler",
    "Create a new FastAPI application with an endpoint for testing",
    "Enable profiling using a decorator or middleware",
    "Run the application using Uvicorn and inspect the results in a JSON format",
    "Analyze the performance data to optimize your edge runtime"
  ],

  "code_examples": [
    {
      "language": "python",
      "code": "```\n\
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request\n\
from apscheduler.schedulers.asyncio import AsyncIOScheduler\n\
app = FastAPI()\n\n@app.on_event('startup')\ndef startup():\n    scheduler = AsyncIOScheduler()\n    scheduler.add_job(profile, trigger='interval', seconds=1)\nscheduler.start()\n\n@app.get('/')\ndef profile():\n    import cProfile\n    return cProfile.run('from my_module import func')\n\ndef func():\n    # Your edge runtime code here\n```"
    }
  ],

  "version_notes": [
    "FastAPI and Uvicorn versions should be compatible with Python 3.12+",
    "Python's built-in cProfile is used for profiling, available in Python 3.7 and later"
  ],

  "caveats": [
    "Profiling results might not represent real-world performance due to the overhead of profiling",
    "For more accurate benchmarking, consider using external tools like Pylot or Pyperf"
  ]
}
